name: Commitment
description: A firm written obligation by the donor to provide resources of a specified amount under specified financial terms and conditions and for specified purposes for the benefit of the recipient

name: Disbursement
description: The amount placed at the disposal of a recipient country or agency (in the case of internal development-related expenditures, the outlay of funds)

name: Expenditure
description: The outlay by the implementing agency on goods and services for the activity

name: Incoming Funds
description: Funds received from an external funding source (eg a donor).

name: Interest Repayment
description: The actual amount of interest repaid, including fees.

name: Loan Repayment
description: The actual amount of principal (amortisation) repaid, including any arrears.

name: Reimbursement
description: A disbursement that covers funds already spent by the recipient, as agreed in the terms of the loan or grant.

name: Purchase of Equity
description: The use of an activity's funds to purchase equity in a business.

name: Sale of Equity
description: The flow of funds into an activity from the sale of equity.

name: Credit Guarantee
description: A commitment made by a funding organisation to underwrite a loan or line of credit entered into by a third party.
